list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 10 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

content.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about your business's importing activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about CE and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.
This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the EU
the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
the main concern to your business

content.description: This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland and any related challenges.
Include
Goods sent to:
GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.
This section asks for information about worker shortages.
This section asks for information about your business's innovation activities.
Innovation is defined as new or significantly improved goods or services as well as processes used to produce or supply all goods or services that have been introduced, regardless of their origin.

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

blocks.title: Trading status of your business
blocks.description: This section asks for general information on your business's trading status.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s trading status?
questions.description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.title: Exporting
blocks.description: This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s exporting status?

options.label: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
options.value: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

options.label: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
options.value: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

values: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

questions.title: Has your business exported goods or services in the last 12 months?

content.description: Include exporting services from your businesses in the UK to an individual or business located outside of the UK
This refers to skills and services that are provided by people and are 'intangible'.
For example, your business may provide a service, such as legal or financial services, to a non-UK business.

questions.title: Have you changed where you have exported your goods or services to in the last three months?
Where has your business exported goods or services to in the last three months?

options.label: Not exported in the last three months
options.value: Not exported in the last three months

questions.title: How did your business's exporting in April 2022 compare with this calendar month last year?
Did your business experience any of the following challenges with exporting goods or services in April 2022?

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules-of-origin certifications

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to export
options.value: Finding information on how to export

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
options.value: Reduced demand for products and services

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
options.value: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications

options.label: Did not experience any challenges with exporting
options.value: Did not experience any challenges with exporting

values: Did not experience any challenges with exporting

questions.title: What was the main cause of these exporting challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

questions.title: How much disruption to your business have these challenges caused?
Which of the following support options has your business benefitted from, to help with exporting challenges?

options.label: Finding new overseas contacts or customers
options.value: Finding new overseas contacts or customers

options.label: Information on exporting
options.description: For example, changes to requirements following the end of the EU transition period

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

This refers to skills and services that are provided by people and are 'intangible'.
For example, your business may receive a service, such as research or construction, from a non-UK business.

options.value: Not imported in the last three months

options.value: Finding information on how to import

options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment

options.label: Finding new overseas contacts or customers

blocks.title: UK Conformity Assessed (UKCA) marking
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about CE and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.

questions.title: Does your business manufacture, import, or distribute products that require either a CE marking or the new UKCA marking?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'CE and UKCA markings'

content.description: The UKCA (UK Conformity Assessed) marking is a new UK product marking that is used for goods being placed on the market in GB. It covers most goods that previously required the CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) marking.

options.label: Yes, we manufacture products that  need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we manufacture products that  need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

values: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we manufacture products that  need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

questions.title: Is your business aware that most CE marked products need to be UKCA marked from 1 January 2023?
questions.description: In August 2021, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by one year from 1 January 2022 to 1 January 2023, for most products.

questions.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, the UKCA marking by 1 January 2023?
questions.description: In August 2021, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by one year from 1 January 2022 to 1 January 2023, for most products.

options.label: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA
options.value: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA

options.label: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2023
options.value: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2023

options.label: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business
options.value: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business

blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • the availability of materials, goods and services within the EU
  • the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
  • global supply chain disruption
  • the main concern to your business

questions.title: Was your business able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from the EU in April 2022?

options.label: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed

options.label: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
options.value: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions

options.value: No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed

options.label: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed

options.label: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
options.value: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions

options.value: No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed

questions.title: Did your business experience any global supply chain disruption in April 2022?

definitions.title: Examples of global supply chain disruption

questions.title: Which of the following, if any, will be the main concern for your business in May 2022?

options.label: Competition
options.description: This refers to competition with other UK businesses

options.label: Inflation of goods and services prices
options.value: Inflation of goods and services prices

blocks.title: Sending goods to Northern Ireland
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland and any related challenges.

Include

Goods sent to:

  • other businesses
  • other parts of your business
  • individual customers

GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} sent goods from GB to Northern Ireland in the last 12 months?

content.description: Include
Goods sent from GB to Northern Ireland to:
This refers to ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

questions.title: In April 2022, how did the volume of goods your business sent from GB to Northern Ireland compare with the previous calendar month?

options.label: Stopped sending goods to Northern Ireland
options.value: Stopped sending goods to Northern Ireland

questions.title: Please give more details about why the volume of goods sent from GB to Northern Ireland changed in April 2022

blocks.title: Innovation
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your business's innovation activities.

Innovation is defined as new or significantly improved goods or services as well as processes used to produce or supply all goods or services that have been introduced, regardless of their origin.

questions.title: How has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s innovation changed since March 2020?

content.description: Exclude mandatory changes to comply with coronavirus (COVID-19) regulations
This refers to new or significantly improved goods or services as well as processes used to produce or supply all goods or services that have been introduced, regardless of their origin.

guidance.show_guidance: Why are we asking this question?
guidance.hide_guidance: Why are we asking this question?

content.description: We want to understand how innovation has changed since the start of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.

questions.title: In which of the following areas, if any, did your business increase innovation since March 2020?

content.description: Exclude mandatory changes to comply with coronavirus (COVID-19) regulations

options.label: Adoption of home or hybrid working
options.value: Adoption of home or hybrid working

options.label: Improvement of existing products and services
options.value: Improvement of existing products and services

options.label: Improvements in methods of logistics, delivery or distribution
options.value: Improvements in methods of logistics, delivery or distribution

options.label: Improvements in methods of manufacturing products and services
options.value: Improvements in methods of manufacturing products and services

options.label: Introduction of new products and services
options.value: Introduction of new products and services

questions.title: In which of the following areas, if any, did your business make adjustments to support innovations since March 2020?

content.description: Exclude mandatory changes to comply with coronavirus (COVID-19) regulations
This refers to the areas in which your business has changed management practices.

options.label: Processes for dealing with, and anticipating, problems
options.value: Processes for dealing with, and anticipating, problems

options.label: Business did not make any adjustments
options.value: Business did not make any adjustments
